citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
The Attending Veterinarian was not informed of an ulcerated mass on the left wing of bald eagle, Dratini, in a timely
manner. According to veterinary records, the facility staff first noticed the mass for at least 2 weeks, and it had gotten
larger prior to taking Dratini to the attending veterinarian for an exam. Also, the records show the facility indicated the
mass had started to bleed about 2 days before the exam on 02/28/2022. The mass was described by the veterinarian’s
notes as a “5 x 5 cm pedunculated and ulcerated mass lateral carpus/distal Rad/ulna” and required surgical removal due
to its large size and being ulcerated. The animal healed well from surgery and has had no further complications. Due to
the size and ulcerative and bleeding description of the mass in the veterinary records, this animal may have experienced
unrelieved pain or distress from failure to timely notify and convey animal health problems to the attending veterinarian.
Daily observation of all animals to assess their well-being, and direct and frequent communication with the attending
veterinarian is required so that timely and accurate information on problems of animal health and well-being is conveyed
to the attending veterinarian.
Correct from this day, 11/20/2024, forward.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
Additional Inspectors:
ALEXANDRA ANDRICOS, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n

narrative:
2.40(b)(3)  Critical
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors). 
The Attending Veterinarian was not informed of an ulcerated mass on the left wing of bald eagle, Dratini, in a timely

Daily observation of all animals to assess their well-being, and direct and frequent communication with the attending

to the attending veterinarian. 
 
Correct from this day, 11/20/2024, forward. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative. 
 
Additional Inspectors: 
ALEXANDRA ANDRICOS, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n

species.common: RED FOX (INCLUDES SILVER FOX & CROSS FOX)
